title: Sampler, 1734
medium:
Medium: silk and metal-wrapped silk embroidery; paper and linen foundation
Technique: embroidered in cross, herringbone, unequal herringbone, satin, stem, back, running, double running and chain stitches, couching over paper, detached loop and twist (need
description: Linen sampler, darkened with age, embroidered in blues, greens, yellow, white and pale pink silks. Serpent curving around apple tree with Adam and Eve at either side, surrounded by animals and flowers.  Inscription at bottom reads "Ann Peartree, Her work 1734."

tombstone.epitaph:
Sampler, 1734.
1734. Medium: silk and metal-wrapped silk embroidery; paper and linen foundation
Technique: embroidered in cross, herringbone, unequal herringbone, satin, stem, back, running, double running and chain stitches, couching over paper, detached loop and twist (need. Bequest of Gertrude M. Oppenheimer. 1981-28-157.
